reviews.text: Very clean and specious room, friendly staffs, quiet, great breakfast which includes eggs, potatoes, meats, quiches, fresh juices, and several baked items. Swimming pool was very clean and cozy. We paid $149 a night for one king bed, and two futons with a big bathroom, mini fridge, and beautiful patio. The Kern River is just steps away. If you want to relax and enjoy the beauty of nature, check this place out!
reviews.title: Love this B & B!

likes.liked: — Peaceful and relaxing location with great breakfast and staffs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought we were in New England from the service and the room decor. Spotless accommodations and a great breakfast - best of the bed and breakfasts!
reviews.title: New England in the mountains!
Second trip as good as the first, or maybe even better.
reviews.text: I just returned from my second trip to Whispering Pines located in Kernville, CA. The room was not the most modern looking, but of course it’s not supposed to be. It is rustic but with one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. That includes my bed a home. (….which I am now changing.) The working fireplace, the porch out the back door overlooking the river, and the breakfast all went to making a peaceful and restful place to spend a few days. The location is ideal for a little sight seeing if you are the adventuresome type. There is a winding road following the river that has a number of places you can pull off the road and just enjoy the sights and sounds. All in all a place I would unhesitatingly recommend to any and all of my friends. Ross Adkins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ernie and I spent our 15th Anniversary recently at the incredible Whispering Pines Bed & Breakfast Lodge in the Sequoia National Forest. We were greeted by Catherine who not only accompanied us to our beautiful river view “Barbra Streisand Suite” but also guided us on a tour of the property. I cannot begin to express the beauty of the grounds. The care taken with food presentation - at the gourmet country breakfast - adds to the richness of the experience at “Pines”. A pinnacle of the stay was after a long romantic walk along the Kern River and the 8 acres of tall tree and gardens - we definitely felt we were in heaven!
reviews.title: We Loved Kernville

reviews.text: The suite where we stayed was very comfortable and roomy. It was quiet and had a nice view. I was a bit worried everything would be ultra Victorian, but the room was tastefully decorated and fit the atmosphere nicely.
reviews.title: big changes with new owners
a place toshout about!
reviews.text: Friendly, quaint lodge right on the river. Country-style comfy rooms, most with fireplaces and views of the river, mountains, trees and wildlife.But, whatever you do, do NOT miss the fantastic complimentary breakfast!! Absolutely the best we have ever had; several different main course specialties each day in addition to the usual breakfast choices, served in a charming Victorian dining room with fireplace and great music or choose seating under the trees on the deck. The perfect way to start your day in this fun little town. We can't wait to come back each year.(P.S. Try lunch at Cheryl's Diner across from the park in town and don't miss the shops!)

reviews.title: Awesome Place
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I went stayed at WP for Valentine's day. We have a beautiful room with a fireplace and huge bathroom overlooking the river. It was so relaxing and romantic. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast in the morning was amazing. A full home cooked breakfast. I would deifinatly go back and stay there again. I would highly recommend WP.

reviews.title: The worst experience ever!!!!
reviews.text: I made a reservation at Whispering Pines Lodge and secured my reservation with a credit card for arrival on August 13, 2004. I was even given a confirmation number. Upon arriving with my family, I was told that they had given our room to someone else. When I was finally able to find the owner and speak to her, she most rudely told me that our predicament was "too bad" and there was nothing she could do about renting our already paid for room right out from under us. When I tried to reason with her, she said I could leave right now and closed the door in my face. I understand the lodge has new owners. I urge anyone goind to Kernville to avoid the Whispering Pines Lodge and the new owners at all costs. Really bad service. Really bad business. They caused us so much stress and practically ruined our entire vacation.

reviews.title: Why mess with perfection?
reviews.text: We stayed at the Whispering Pines Lodge in July 2004. I had selected the McCambridge Lodge not knowing anything about the town of Kernville or the hotels. When we arrived at the McCambridge Lodge after two days of rafting the Kern River (amazing experience with Whitewater Voyages), the owner had given the one and only "cabin" that we reserved two months prior away (and to think I had re-confirmed the reservation just two days prior). We were offered a less than desirable smaller room at a slightly reduced rate for the inconvenience but were so disappointed by the way we were treated at McCambridge (and the less than desirable appearance of the McCambridge inside and out) that we opted to try our luck elsewhere. How fortunate we were to find a room at Whispering Pines Lodge just up the street. It was a bit more pricey but we had an amazing room with full kitchen, gorgeous balcony and a gas fireplace (though not needed in July, it was very pretty and romantic). The decor is perfect and the breakfast was outstanding. Service was great. After getting to know the town a little more, there are a number of quaint places to stay, but why mess with perfection? Stay at Whispering Pines. It's top notch, quiet and an ideal location. We'll go back.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: Only a 1 night stay, room was superbly equipped and located. Very friendly staff, excellent breakfast. Try Mc Nally's for Steaks (24 oz filet mignon! - eats like butter). Wish we had booked for longer.

reviews.title: A slice of heaven in the mountains
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at WP twice. I had done a lot of research on places to stay in Kernville and decided to take a chance on WP based on the information on the website.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whispering Pines is a magical place that we've come back to several times now! The romantic charm of the rooms is matched by the soothing sounds of the Kern river flowing just downhill from the rooms. The rooms (we saw several) were wonderfully appointed, with a cozy fireplaces and a large decks. The breakfast was a main attraction, the best there is. The staff was very gracious and helpful.
reviews.title: A magical place!

likes.disliked: — we had to leave too soon!

reviews.text: There's one large suite which I'd encourage anyone looking for a Honeymoon suite to grab. A full apartment with huge surrounding decks, walk in fireplace and full kitchen, it also has a king size bed to die for. I understand it's been the get-away Honeymoon suite for several top movies stars.
reviews.title: Overrated.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whispering Pines is an overrated B&B
reviews.title: Fantastic, only wish we'd stayed longer!

reviews.text: It was all the little things that added up that makes this place overrated. As a previous member mentioned, the air conditioner in our room was horrific. It was very loud and ineffective during the hottest part of the day. The staff wasn’t friendly or approachable and they made no effort to make you feel like a valued guest. The breakfast lacked any taste or creativity as compared to most B&B’s I’ve stayed at. The bed was comfortable, however the décor was “off”. The water was brownish orange (rusty) when first turned on in the morning. The only positive was the outside aesthetics. Overall, Whispering Pines is very over-priced. There’s nothing special about this B&B. I highly disagree w/ the prior-reviews, they should expect more.
reviews.title: Sorry, but we thought it was over-rated by prior reviews

reviews.text: We stayed at Whispering Pines en route from Death Valley to the coast. Kernville is on the banks of the river Kern, just above Lake Isabella. The area is outstandingly beautiful (think Brad Pitt in A River Runs Through It).
reviews.title: Beautiful setting
